items.title: Swiss bar owner taken into custody over New Year's blaze that killed 40
items.summary: One of two owners of a Swiss ski resort bar has been detained following a New Year's Day fire that killed 40 people.

items.title: The male breadwinner is gone. Why working from home is necessary for modern families
items.summary: Cost of living pressures mean both parents often need to work and there's one flexible arrangement that has become crucial to the functioning of households.

items.title: She was with her the day she died in Bondi. Now Matilda's grandmother wants change
items.summary: Lena was supposed to attend the Hannukah by the Sea event in Bondi where her 10-year-old granddaughter Matilda was killed.

items.title: Writers pull out of Adelaide festival as dropped Palestinian author claims 'racist' treatment
items.summary: Adelaide Writer's Week has come under pressure from prominent writers from its decision to drop a Palestinian author after the Bondi attack.

items.title: Where will prices grow the most? This year's property market predictions
items.summary: Some believe there could be a "levelling out" of the market.

items.title: Usman Khawaja told me his 'dream' 19 years ago. He's changed Australian cricket forever
items.summary: The first Muslim player to don the baggy green didn't know what was ahead of him when he spoke to SBS as a teenager.

items.title: Three people missing, homes destroyed as dozens of fires burn across Victoria
items.summary: A gusty southerly change is bringing the first relief to heatwave-affected areas, but communities are warned about the threat of damaging winds and lightning.

items.title: Changing winds challenge firefighters in Victoria as three people missing in worst fire day in years — as it happened
items.summary: As ferocious blazes scorch Victoria, parts of NSW and South Australia are also experiencing extreme heat in the forties.

items.title: 'Enough is enough': Trump's warning for the world with Russia-linked tanker seizure
items.summary: The US has seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the Atlantic, after tracking it for weeks and calling in the assistance of the UK.

items.title: Should Australia give names to heatwaves?
items.summary: In Australia, the only severe weather events that receive formal names are tropical cyclones. Could there be benefits to naming all of our extreme weather?

items.title: US federal agents shoot two people in Portland, police say, as Minneapolis fallout mounts
items.summary: The US homeland security department confirmed that a border patrol agent had fired shots.

items.title: Venezuela announces release of 'significant number' of prisoners in 'peace' gesture
items.summary: The prisoner releases appear to be a concession to the US after its ouster of leader Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: Minnesota officials accuse FBI of blocking them from ICE shooting investigation
items.summary: Local and federal authorities continue to clash and protesters have taken to the streets after the fatal shooting of a woman in the US city of Minneapolis.

items.title: How hot can it get? Australia's record-high temperatures — and where they were set
items.summary: Here's a look at the country's most extreme temperature records.

items.title: Albanese announces Bondi terror royal commission as Ley says he was 'forced' into it
items.summary: The announcement has been welcomed by the antisemitism envoy, while a state-level royal commission in NSW will no longer go ahead.

items.title: 'Leave as soon as possible': Advice for Australians updated as deadly protests escalate
items.summary: DFAT says a violent crackdown on protests in Iran has left many "injured, killed or detained", and is urging Australians to depart the country.

items.title: How to slash your bills and get money back into your pocket quickly
items.summary: If you want to get your year started on the right financial footing, here are 10 ways to save money.

items.title: Structures lost in Victoria bushfire as Australians swelter through intense heatwave
items.summary: Much of Australia is being gripped by a heatwave, which will bring "catastrophic" fire danger to Victoria on Friday.

items.title: US outlines plan to control Venezuelan oil 'indefinitely' as tankers seized in North Atlantic
items.summary: US secretary of state Marco Rubio has outlined a three-fold process for Venezuela's future, focusing on stabilisation, recovery and transition.

items.title: Woman fatally shot by ICE in Minneapolis identified, officials spar over cause of shooting
items.summary: The US government said the agent fired in self-defence, while the local mayor said video of the incident contradicted that narrative.

items.title: Trump pulls out of UN climate agreement, 66 bodies deemed 'contrary' to US interests
items.summary: The US will withdraw from the treaty underpinning all major international climate agreements and the UN climate science body, according to a White House memo.

items.title: I'm 50, I've failed, and I finally feel like myself
items.summary: In her 40s, Sarah experienced divorce, alcoholism and job loss. Now in her 50s, she's reinventing herself.

items.title: Behind Trump's controversial push to acquire Greenland
items.summary: Trump's attention is again on Greenland — but why? Here's what to know, as allies raise alarm and talks are set for next week.

items.title: Greenland says it will join talks with US and Denmark amid Trump acquisition push
items.summary: Greenland has repeatedly stated it does not wish to be part of the US, which, under Donald Trump, has expressed interest in acquiring the Danish territory.
